intro: Picrella trifoliata var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender-leaf picrella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink, clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native habitat.
